Templates¶

Use Jinja2 as templating language.

Use Babel for Internationalisation (I18N).

Get the site settings:

{{ site.title }}

Get the page settings:

{{ page.author }}

Link to another page:

<p>Go to <a href="{{ url("dir_1/dir_2/other_page") }}">
other page</a></p>

Link to an asset:

<img src="{{ asset_url("img/grass-mud-horse2.jpg") }}">

Load some configuration settings:

{% set data = load_config("test.yaml") %}
{% for k, v in data.items() %}
        <div>Found key "{{k}}" with value "{{v}}".</div>
{% endfor %}

Use Markdown:

{% filter markdown %}

This is Markdown
================

dflkjahflafdf kwewer werj qwölkrjwöekr
{: #first-para .some-css-class data-foo="bar" }

- aaa
- bbb
- ccc


Col 1 | Col 2 | Right Aligned
------|-------|--------------:
cell1 | cell2 | 1000
cell3 | cell4 |    12.45

{% endfilter %}

Active extensions for Markdown: ‘abbr’, ‘attr_list’, ‘def_list’, ‘fenced_code’, ‘footnotes’, ‘smart_strong’, ‘tables’, ‘codehilite’, ‘sane_lists’, ‘toc’

Sass compiler for CSS is integrated. Define sass.infile and sass.outfile in the site’s config file rc.yaml and call the compiler from the editor with <ALT+S> (Save and compile).
